content.description: A recommended classic. The start is the crux. It's a overhung fist jam with little feet. Hand and fist jam up to the top. Watch out for the loss rock at top.
content.protection: Camalots 1-3.5. Double #1's and 2's. Optional #5 friend. NO bolted anchor! Can top out/attach webbing at top, but bring a lot.
content.location: As you boat into Cedar Canyon it is on your left. It is the small butte. Park boat in first small side canyon, beneath crag. Lots of cracks to be explored here.

content.description: Fun liebacking for the beginning. chimney up middle to a hand jam overhang. First crux is the first few moves. The little overhang is a fun crux as well.
content.protection: Small TCU's for start and anchor. Hand and fist sizes for the rest. No Bolted anchor
content.location: In area known as Flying Buttress. As you boat into Cedar Canyon it is on your left. It is the small butte. Park boat in first small side canyon, beneath crag.

content.description:
30' of offwidth/chimney to the top of a pillar with a good bolt at the midway point.  Then wide hands for 30' up to a small stance with two drilled pins (added after the FA, but good for a rap with 60m).  Then 80' of cruiser hands (#2 Camelots all the way).... to a single bolt rap.

Maybe the purest climbing I've ever done at Powell.  A beautiful, obvious line.
content.protection: Big-bro or wide gear for the start, #3 Camelots to the little ledge with the drilled pins, #2s the rest of the way.
content.location: On the south side of the lake at mile 110.5
